title.narrative: COMMUNITY CAPACITY FOR HIGH-IMPACT ANDINTEGRATED INTERVENTIONS

description.narrative: By 2022, the community platforms are equipped to provide high-impact interventions of integrated health / HIV, nutrition and quality Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Child Health (Covid), Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Disaster Risk Reduction, Early Childhood Development, Environmental Sustainability, Hiv Prevention, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition (Covid), Sanitation, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022,boys and girls aged 0-59 months, adolescents and women (especially those living in the most disadvantaged communities) have access to basic services, use packages of multisectoral high-impact, gender-sensitive interventions (health /HIV, nutrition, WASH) and adopt appropriate behaviours.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, the community platforms are equipped to provide high-impact interventions of integrated health / HIV, nutrition and quality WASH services.

description.narrative: Capacity of the 40 convergence municipalities was strengthened with the empowerment of local communities on skills transferred, including health. A total of 1,885 RECOs and 190 CHWs were trained and equipped to offer the integrated health/HIV, nutrition and WASH intervention package. Formative supervision carried out by the Ministries of Health and Territorial Administration and Decentralization and UNICEF made it possible to strengthen local governance and the quality of services provided to the most vulnerable communities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
